p: In the EPA-group, the intake of EPA-enriched oil leads to an increment in the incorporation of omega-3 in cell membranes in comparison to the Control group. This increase was related with elevation in M2 macrophages and in interleukin-10, a key anti-inflammatory cytokine produced by this cell population. This anti-inflammatory effect of EPA was associated with delayed wound closure and reorganization of collagen because absence of IL-10 abolished the deleterious effects of EPA and the increase of M2 macrophages (Fig.Â 5).
